Title: Relational urban models: Parameters, values and tacit forms of algorithms
Abstract: © Copyright 2016 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.Parameter-dependent processes have huge potential for urban design and planning, which is shaped by the relational input of a number of parties or stakeholders. Enriqueta Llabres and Eduardo Rico of the multidisciplinary London-based office Relational Urbanism describe how they have developed participatory urban models that translate data into parameters, bringing to the fore the influences of shared relational values.
